info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 5:49AM EDT until October 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding.
* WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County.
* WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 10 PM EDT this evening, especially around the time of high tide.
* IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary's River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 6:44 PM and 6:47 AM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 7:35 AM and 7:48 PM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 6:59 AM and 7:12 PM.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING
